intro: Corynandra telanganensis, commonly known as the Telangana corynandra, is a flowering plant native to the Indian state of Telangana. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are often grouped in inflorescences, making it visually distinct. It is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its native range.
